qas.question: What is the typical size of a ceramic mosaic tile?
What is usually the purpose of a tile mosaic in pools?
Where is the most common application of tile mosaics?

answers.text: on a shower room or bathing pool floor

qas.question: How should the tiles be aligned next to each other?

context: A tile mosaic is a digital image made up of individual tiles, arranged <a3_0>in a non-overlapping fashion<a3_0/>, e.g. to make a static image <a2_0>on a shower room or bathing pool floor<a2_0/>, by breaking the image down into square pixels formed from ceramic tiles (a typical size is <a0_0>1 in × 1 in<a0_0/> (25 mm × 25 mm), as for example, on the floor of the University of Toronto pool, though sometimes larger tiles such as 2 in × 2 in (51 mm × 51 mm) are used). These digital images are coarse in resolution and often simply <a1_0>express text<a1_0/>, such as the depth of the pool in various places, but some such digital images are used to show a sunset or other beach theme.
